meanings.definition: A multiplexer is a device that combines multiple signals into one signal for transmission.
meanings.sent1: The mux in our TV helps us watch different channels on one screen.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed a new mux to improve the signal quality.
meanings.sent3: I wonder how the tiny mux can fit so many signals together!
meanings.sent4: The multiplexer acts like a traffic cop, directing all the signals into one lane.
meanings.sent5: The mux is like a magic box that merges all the signals seamlessly.

meanings.definition: To mux is to combine multiple signals into one signal for transmission.
meanings.sent1: We need to mux the audio and video feeds before broadcasting.
meanings.sent2: The software allows you to mux different data streams efficiently.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally muxed the wrong channels together, creating a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: She has the ability to mux words and music into beautiful poetry.
meanings.sent5: Muxing requires precision to ensure all signals merge perfectly.
